Package net.openhft.chronicle.network.connection

Class TcpChannelHub

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.chronicle.network.connection.TcpChannelHub
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, net.openhft.chronicle.core.io.Closeable
    public class TcpChannelHub
extends Object
implements net.openhft.chronicle.core.io.Closeable
    The TcpChannelHub is used to send your messages to the server and then read the servers response. The TcpChannelHub ensures that each response is marshalled back onto the appropriate client thread. It does this through the use of a unique transaction ID ( we call this transaction ID the "tid" ), when the server responds to the client, its expected that the server sends back the tid as the very first field in the message. The TcpChannelHub will look at each message and read the tid, and then marshall the message onto your appropriate client thread. Created by Rob Austin

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe​(@NotNull
                      net.openhft.chronicle.network.connection.AsyncSubscription asyncSubscription)
        sets up subscriptions with the server, even if the socket connection is down, the subscriptions will be re-establish with the server automatically once it comes back up. To end the subscription with the server call net.openhft.chronicle.network.connection.TcpChannelHub#unsubscribe(long)
        Parameters:
        asyncSubscription - detail of the subscription that you wish to hold with the server
